```html AI Design and Modeling — SpectraMind V50

AI Design and Modeling — SpectraMind V50

NeurIPS 2025 Ariel Challenge Reproducible

North Star

From raw Ariel telescope **FGS1/AIRS frames** → calibrated light curves → mean (μ) and uncertainty (σ) spectra across 283 bins → diagnostics dashboards → leaderboard-ready submission.

Architecture Overview

  • FGS1 Encoder: Mamba SSM for long-sequence temporal structure.
  • AIRS Encoder: Graph Neural Network (edges = wavelength proximity, molecule type, detector region).
  • Decoders: Dual-head for μ and σ, optional diffusion/quantile variants.
  • Curriculum: MAE pretraining → contrastive fine-tuning → GLL + symbolic optimization.
  • Losses: GLL, FFT smoothness, asymmetry, symbolic alignment, COREL uncertainty calibration.

Uncertainty & Symbolic Integration

The pipeline integrates multiple layers of calibration:

  • Temperature Scaling: Global calibration of predictive uncertainty.
  • Conformal Prediction (COREL): Binwise coverage guarantees.
  • Symbolic Constraints: Smoothness, non-negativity, FFT symmetry, photonic alignment.

Explainability & Dashboard

  • SHAP overlays for AIRS and FGS1 features.
  • Latent → symbolic rule mapping with UMAP/t-SNE plots.
  • Fusion of decoder attention and symbolic influence scores.
  • Interactive HTML dashboard with spectrum overlays, CLI log summaries, and symbolic violation heatmaps.

Engineering & Reproducibility

  • Configs: Hydra YAMLs with defaults and overrides.
  • Data: DVC + lakeFS for full dataset versioning.
  • Experiments: MLflow logging with config hashes and runtime capture.
  • Runtime: Docker + Poetry + CUDA for guaranteed reproducibility.
  • CI/CD: GitHub Actions with diagnostics validation, leaderboard packaging, and smoke tests.

Kaggle Integration

Pipeline constrained to ≤9 hours across 1,100 planets on Kaggle GPU. FGS1 transit shape is leveraged for AIRS alignment and jitter augmentation. Submission workflow: spectramind submit runs prediction, validation, COREL calibration, and packaging.
